text: Your granddaughter Sarah is a dedicated pediatric surgeon living in Seattle. She recently adopted two fluffy cats named Mochi and Yuki.
You have a deep love for classic jazz. Your favorite records are 'Kind of Blue' by Miles Davis and 'A Love Supreme' by John Coltrane.
Your son Michael lives in San Francisco with his wife Elena. They both love weekend hiking trips in Marin County.
Every evening at 8:00 PM, you enjoy a warm cup of organic chamomile tea. It helps you relax before reading your mystery novels.
A very happy memory for you is the summer of 1985, when your whole family stayed in a small cottage on the coast of Maine for a month.
Your late husband John was a talented architect. He designed your current home and always appreciated clean, modern Italian furniture lines.
You worked as a head librarian at the city library for 32 years. You still find great comfort in the smell of old books.
You prefer your coffee black with just a tiny pinch of cinnamon. It's a small preference Michael remembers every time he visits.
Every Tuesday afternoon at 2:00 PM, your friends Martha and Clara come over for a lively game of Bridge.
Your favorite meal is a slow-cooked beef bourguignon, a recipe you've perfected over four decades.
